result.eng: She slipped while she was going up the stairs.

result.eng: I'll be up in Derry.
result.ga: Beidh mé ó thuaidh i nDoire

result.ponchtml: Beiḋ mé ó ṫuaiḋ i nDoireI'll be up in Derry.

result.eng: I got the idea while getting up in the morning.

result.eng: The walk had warmed me up a little.

result.eng: They were bringing up a family.

result.ga: Brostaigh ort

result.eng: I went up to Dublin.

result.eng: He forced her to give up the child.

result.eng: I got up at eight in the morning.
result.ga: D'éirigh mé ar a hocht a chlog ar maidin

result.eng: They woke me up.

result.eng: Hurry up, the train is about to leave!

result.eng: I said to myself that I would get up very early in the morning.

result.eng: Leave it up to me.

result.eng: I woke up early in the morning.

result.eng: Are you late waking up each morning?

result.eng: Will we have to put up with this whimpering for long?

result.eng: They made up a new name for her.
result.ga: Cheap siad ainm nua di

result.eng: I remember waking up Sunday morning, crying.

result.eng: Some ten years ago I got up from bed in a small apartment.
result.ga: Beagnach deich mbliana ó shin d'éirigh mé as an leaba in árasán beag
result.orig: Beagnach deich mbliana ó shin d'éirigh mé as an leaba in árasán beag

result.eng: Up I went to room 1026 at the top of the house.
result.ga: Suas liom go seomra 1026 ar bharr an tí

result.eng: Shut up!
result.ga: Bí i do thost

result.html: Bí i do thostShut up!

result.eng: I'd like to be a priest when I grow up.

result.eng: She was growing up to be a girl.

result.eng: As soon as one grows up, the fun is over.

result.eng: He ate it up from his hand.

result.eng: He would put up with anything for her.
